intro: Morinda debilis, commonly known as the weak morinda or small morinda, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its small, often hairy leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Morinda debilis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive foliage.
